All.notes: Cases of pneumonia of an unknown cause surface
World Health Organization is told about the cases
44 patients with mysterious illness are reported, more than half have links to Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market in Wuhan
A novel coronavirus is identified and isolated by Chinese authorities
China shares genetic sequence of the virus for countries to use to develop diagnostic kits
World Health Organization declares the outbreak to be a "public health emergency of international concern"
World Health Organization names the disease COVID-19
More cases reported from countries outside of China than from in China
World Health Organization declares coronavirus a pandemic
Europe becomes epicentre of the pandemic
Total number of cases and deaths ouside China has overtaken the total number of cases in China
US to halt World Health Organization funding

United States.notes: US starts screening arriving passengers from or connecting through Wuhan
Trump asks "everyone to work at home, if possible, postpone unnecessary travel, and limit social gatherings to no more than 10 people"
Trump says he wants country to open by April, "cure" can't be "worse than the problem itself"
15 Day plan to slow the spread

Dr. Anthony Fauci, the government's top infectious disease expert, said Tuesday that the U.S. does not yet have the critical testing and tracing procedures needed to begin reopening the nation's economy
Trump announces US will halt World Health Organization funding

Australia.notes: Queensland declares public health emergency
Foreign nationals banned from mainland China
Travel ban from Iran
RBA becomes first central bank to cut interest rates in response to the outbreak
Travel ban from South Korea
Travel ban from Italy
Government announces A$17.6B stimulus package
Social distancing measures in schools put to place
Gatherings of more than 500 people are cancelled, All travellers arriving in Australia must self isolate for 14 days
Western Australia declares state of emergency
South Australia declares public health emergency
ACT declares public health emergency
Victoria declares state of emergency
Tasmania declares public health emergency
Reserve Bank of Australia cuts interest rates further
Non-essential travellers to the state were subjected to a mandatory 14-day quarantine
Australian borders closed to all non-residents and non-Australia citizens
Social distancing rules put to place
Bondi beach among with other beaches were closed
Government announces second stimulus package amounting to A$66B
"Major Emergency" declared giving the police power to enforce self-isolaion rules
School holiday brought forward
Stage 1 Lockdown (schools remain open)
Arrivals required to self-isolate for a period of 14 days
State borders closed, People arriving interstate required to self-isolate for 14 days
All interstate arrivals were required to self-isolate for 14 days
Stage 1 Lockdown
Stage 2 Lockdown
Public gatherings are limited to two people, Four acceptable reasons to leave their houses
Government announces A$130B "JobKeeper" wage subsidy program
Stage 3 Lockdown
All state borders closed
Stage 4 Lockdown
State of emergency extended until May 11
Repatriation plan from Uruguay lands in Melbourne
Tasmanian government closed the North West Regional Hospital and North West Private Hospital for cleaning, and put the entire staff of over 1000 people and their families into quarantine
Western Australian man became the first person in Australia to be jailed for breaking a self-isolation directive
Government announces it will ease elective surgery restrictions
Queensland becomes first state to announce easing of restrictions
Premiere announces lockdown to be relaxed from Friday
ACT becomes the first state/territory to be free of known cases of COVID-19
NT becomes first state to open pubs, restaurants and cafes

Philippines.notes: Philippines records first confirmed death outside mainland China
Philippines declares a public health emergency
Metro Manila is placed under community quarantine
Government unveils a ₱27.1B initial spending plan for COVID-19 response
Luzon is placed under enhanced community quarantine
Displaced workers receive a one-time ₱5,000 financial aid with a ₱1.2B budget
Government approves a two-month emergency subsidy program for 18M families worth ₱200B
Government buys 1M sets of PPE for health workers for ₱1.8B
Philippines grants a one-time special risk allowance for medical frontliners
Luzon lockdown is extended to April 30
Government announces $200 aid for overseas Filipino workers displaced by lockdowns abroad

New Zealand.notes: Government places entry restrictions on foreign nationals travelling from or transiting through mainland China
Chartered flight carrying 193 evacuees from Wuhan touches down in Auckland and are quarantined for 14 days
Government places restrictions on people travelling to New Zealand from Iran
Government announces anyone who has visited northern Italy and South Korea must self-isolate for 14 days
Anyone entereing the country must self isolate
Ardern says any tourists that enter New Zealand and don't self-quarantine will be deported
Reserve Bank announces an emergency official cash rate cut
Government announces a $12.1B package to cushion the impact of New Zealand's economy
For the first time in history, the government closes the country's borders to all but New Zealand citizens and permanent residents
Government introduces a four-level alert system, starts at level two
Ardern announces country has moved to alert level three
New Zealand declares state of emergency and prepares to go in to alert level four, lock-down for a minimum of four weeks
Government claims it has eliminated community acquired COVID-19, downgrades to alert Level 3

Italy.notes: Government imposes quarantine of 11 municipalities in Northern Italy
Austria suspends all trains to and from Italy, Romania instituted quarantine for people arriving from certain Italian cities
Countries begin recommending travellers coming from Italy to self-quarantine for 14 days
Government imposes shutdown of all schools nationwide
Army deployed to help process the number of dead residents
Ministry of health orders tighter regulations on free movement
Government announces new economic stimulus plan costing €400B
Government closes all Italian ports until 31 July

Canada.notes: Federal government offers $27M in funding to research groups to develop means of managing the outbreak
Government announced $1B respond fund
Trudeau self-isolates after his wife tests positive for COVID
The NHL and most other sports leagues suspend seasons
Ottawa opens first assessment centre
Quebec tells seniors to stay home
Truedeau urges against panic buying
Apart from Americans and a few exceptions, Canada announces it is closing its borders to non-Canadians
Alberta declares state of emergency
Ontario declares state of emergency
Trudeau announces $82B in financial aid
Country's six big banks announce mortgate payments defered for up to six months
British Columbia declares state of emergency
Saskatchewan declares state of emergency
Feds roll out $27B in new spending and $55B in credit to help families and businesses
New Brunswick declares state of emergency
Trudeau announces asylum seekers crossing into Canada on foot from the US will be turned back as part of the border shutdown
Manitoba declares state of emergency
Government closes Canada-US border to non-essential traffic
Federal government rolls out $30M advertising campaign focuses on social distancing and personal hygiene
Canada announces repatriation flights for those stranded
Community transmission overtakes travel-related spread
Canada makes 14-day quarantine for arrivals mandatory
Bank of Canada cuts key rate to 0.25%
Canadian Forces put on war footing
Government bans air travel for those with COVID symptoms
Defence Minister Harjit Sajjan says 24,000 Canadian troops ready to help deal with COVID-19
Trudeau says new wage subsidy program will cover all businesses whose revenue has dropped by at least 30 per cent because of COVID-19
Ontario projects COVID-19 death toll could reach 15,000
Quebec calls in the armed forces
3M told by White House to stop exporting N95 masks to Canada
3M makes deal with the White House to provide N95 masks to Canada
Ottawa orders 30,000 ventilators
Government announces more than one million people lost their jobs in March
Wage Subsidy Bill is passed, helping businesses impacted by the COVID-19 crisis

Germany.notes: Germany closes its border with France, Austria and Switzerland

China.notes: No new cases are reported in Wuhan since the outbreak

United Kingdom.notes: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is hospitalised 10 days after testing positive
UK starts major study to track coronavirus infections and immunity

Ecuador.notes: Ecuador's coronavirus case total is twice as high as confirmed: minister

Pakistan.notes: Pakistan to keep mosques open during Ramadan
